title: Collaborative Problem-Solving-Based Project for Light and Shadow Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Capability to use simulation and collaborative tools via digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can mathematically model and explain the principles of light propagation, reflection, and refraction.
Learners can analyze complex optical phenomena (light and shadow) through collaborative problem-solving and recreate them using simulation tools.
Learners demonstrate conceptual application skills by solving at least 80% of practical problems related to light and shadow in formative assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
